captions.text: So let me get this straight… You’re not a cube?
Y’know, you don’t know this man. Where is he taking you?
There’s a settlement up ahead, there should be food there, you must be hungry
TRAVELLERS! YOU MUST HELP US! OUR VILLAGE IS BEING ATTACKED BY A WILD BEAST!
COME QUICK! WE DON’T HAVE MUCH TIME!
NPC Villages are groups of buildings inhabited by non-player characters or NPC's

title: An Egg's Guide to Minecraft - PART 4 - You're not a cube? (Minecraft Animation)

comments.author: Jarvis Mascarenhas

comments.text:
+Luckster Round things sure do exist in vanilla Minecraft. The easiest 
example is shadows. *thinks* Well, you got me there. I can't think of a 
better example.
comments.author: ToCzegoSzukasz

comments.text:
+ToCzegoSzukasz The argument is that "Round" does not exist in the universe 
of Minecraft as it naturally exists. I'm not disputing that "round" does 
not exist when mods are put into place. Obviously, Egg's Guide is based on 
Vanilla Minecraft, in which "round" does not exist, therefore is blasphemy.
comments.author: Luckster

comments.text:
+Luckster For one, I've just said that round shapes are possible in 
Minecraft, resource packs just make it easier. For two, I don't mean flat 
circles, I mean spheres.
comments.author: ToCzegoSzukasz

comments.text:
+ToCzegoSzukasz I don't think this particular series is going to have 
resource packs in mind though. Also I believe "round" is more a spherical 
sense in this context, rather than a flat circle.
comments.author: Luckster

comments.text:
Also in 1.8, you can either make a resource pack with round models or 
summon tons of rotated minecarts displaying blocks around them.
comments.author: ToCzegoSzukasz
